sections.paragraph: 1. "headquarters" in a Roman camp, the tent of the commander - in - chief
2. the palace in which the governor or procurator of a province resided,
Part(s) of speech: Noun Neuter / பெயர்ச்சொல் (அஃறிணை)

ஆங்கில மூலம் / Original in English: Of Latin origin; the praetorium or governor’s court room (sometimes including the whole edifice and camp): - (common, judgment) hall (of judgment), palace, praetorium.
